caseTitle: Muhammad Younis v. Financial Adviser & Chief Accounts Officer, Pakistan Railways and another
tagline: There is bifurcation between pensioners who retired on or before 01.12.2001 and those who retired thereafter which was considered necessary in order to maintain a uniform rise in pension due to the different rate of salaries the ex employees were drawing at the time of their retirement. The distinction between ‘old pensioners’ and ‘new pensioners’ is necessary as the quantum of pension is determined keeping in view the difference of pay in different time periods.
